alert.note: Alert for Coffey; Lyon; Osage (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 6:50PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Osage, northwestern Coffey and northeastern Lyon Counties through 715 PM CDT... At 650 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles southwest of Osage City, moving south at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Osage City, Carbondale, Lyndon, Lebo, Burlingame, Scranton, Reading, Admire, Olivet and Melvern Lake. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 141 and 154. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 139 and 155. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
